Comment:
My favourite. I can be attacked, but I move the game under known ground... at least, I thought it. 
If he goes for the bishop (Nh5), I can choose between three moves (Bg3, Bg5 or even Qd2).

Not as sharp as Bf5, but again, these are known lines, too...
This is "not" a loss of tempo. Because my plan is to shield with c3 and push g4 early. A risky plan I like.
...and now, if Nh5, Bh7.
...and now, if Nh5, Bh7.
If Bd6, Ne5.
Opening a hole in h4 that has to be controlled, I know. But black may feel a little pressed, and move into our game.

Nothing special, black is playing conservatively. Normally, this means I will attack trying to avoid him to castle longside, which normally I cannot avoid. But some moves has to be played still before we get to that point.
g5 must be further prepared, by clearing f3, so Nh5 is not possible.
Normal and good. I can seal the hole in h4 by playing a pawn there, but I wanted to try another move. The one that can go to h4 is a simple bishop, not Her Majesty.
Good. Now white is tangled.
Good. Now white is tangled.
I will have soon to care for h4, so I better avoid fxg4. And I open a potential attack line in g, but not easy to exploit.
Hole sealed again.
Hole sealed again.
Now things goes interesting and tactical. If BxB, NxB and black has a solid game, since the queen can go to e7 defending g2 and can castle queenside. So I played for scrambling the game.
He loses the bishop for a knight, true is that this was a good knight. But I cannot take BxB without returning him the favour, and after NxB, exN, the game is completely different.
He loses the bishop for a knight, true is that this was a good knight. But I cannot take BxB without returning him the favour, and after NxB, exN, the game is completely different.
e6 is not a threat, but it will. So this is a profilactic move, but condemn the bishop. It has a good defensive role, though.

Let's see what happen. He can't Bf7 because of Qxf5.
Ok, the expected one.
Now he has a hole in g5. If only I wouldn't have to lose a tempo moving the lsb after NxN, I'll go for Bg5-f6 with a good grimp on black.
Covering g7 and allowing o-o-o.
Maybe impatient. Nf3 was probably better, threatening Ng5.
